query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Poi che la carità del natio loco 2 mi strinse, raunai le fronde sparte 3 e rende’le a colui, ch’era già fioco.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Then, when the love of my native place 2 constrained me, I gathered the scattered leaves 3 and gave them to him who was already weary.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Tataḥ, yadā mama janmabhūmeḥ prema 2 mama cittam ākrāmat, aham viṣvakṛṣṭāni patrāṇi saṃgṛhītavān 3 tāni ca tasmai dadau yaḥ purataḥ eva śrāntaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Indi venimmo al fine ove si parte 5 lo secondo giron dal terzo, e dove 6 si vede di giustizia orribil arte.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Then we came to the end where one departs 5 from the second round to the third, and where 6 one sees the horrible art of justice.
**Sanskrit:**
4 Tataḥ āgamyāma antaṃ yatra viyujyate 5 dvitīyacakraṃ tṛtīyāt, tatra ca 6 dṛśyate nyāyasya ghoraṃ karma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 A ben manifestar le cose nove, 8 dico che arrivammo ad una landa 9 che dal suo letto ogne pianta rimove.
query.result:
**English:**
7 To manifest the new things clearly, 8 I say that we arrived at a plain 9 that banishes every plant from its bed.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Vastūni nava yathārtham prakāśayitum, 8 aham bruve yathā vayam āgamāma ekaṃ bhūmiṃ, 9 yataḥ sva-śayyāt sarvāṇi vṛkṣāṇi apavartante.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 La dolorosa selva l’è ghirlanda 11 intorno, come ’l fosso tristo ad essa; 12 quivi fermammo i passi a randa a randa.
query.result:
**English:**
10 The sorrowful wood garlands it 11 around, like the dismal moat to it; 12 there we halted our steps, side by side.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Duḥkhamayī vanaṃ tasyāḥ 11 parikara iva, yathā tasya dugdhaḥ parikhā; 12 tatra sthāpayāmaḥ padau pakṣe pakṣe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Lo spazzo era una rena arida e spessa, 14 non d’altra foggia fatta che colei 15 che fu da’ piè di Caton già soppressa.
query.result:
**English:**
13 The ground was a dry and thick sand, 14 made in no other way than that 15 which was once trodden down by Cato's feet.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Bhūmistu śuṣkā āsīt balukāghanaśca, 14 Na anyathā nirmitā yathā sā, 15 Yā kathamcid gatā āsīt pūrvam Kaṭasya pādābhyām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 O vendetta di Dio, quanto tu dei 17 esser temuta da ciascun che legge 18 ciò che fu manifesto a li occhi mei!
19 D’anime nude vidi molte gregge 20 che piangean tutte assai miseramente, 21 e parea posta lor diversa legge.
query.result:
**English:**
16 O vengeance of God, how much you should be 17 feared by everyone who reads 18 what was revealed to my eyes!
19 I saw many herds of naked souls 20 who were all weeping very miserably, 21 and it seemed that different laws had been imposed on them.
**Sanskrit:**
16 O devaśāpa, katham tvamasi 17 bhayāvaham pratyekam pāṭhakāya 18 yat me cakṣuṣā dṛṣṭam abhūt!
19 Nagnakātmānāṃ paśyāmi anekāni vṛndāni 20 ye sarve rudanti ati daruṇam, 21 teṣām ca viśiṣṭā vidhir iva niyuktā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Supin giacea in terra alcuna gente, 23 alcuna si sedea tutta raccolta, 24 e altra andava continüamente.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Some people lay flat on the ground, 23 others sat huddled together, 24 and still others walked about incessantly.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Suptaḥ śete bhūmau kecana janāḥ, 23 kecana upaviśya sarve samāhitāḥ, 24 anye ca anivāryamāṇāḥ caranti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Quella che giva ’ntorno era più molta, 26 e quella men che giacëa al tormento, 27 ma più al duolo avea la lingua sciolta.
query.result:
**English:**
25 That which went around was more numerous, 26 and that which lay in torment was less, 27 but had its tongue more loosed to grief.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Yā parivartate sāpi bahutara āsīt, 26 yā ca śete piḍayām sāpi alpikā, 27 duḥkhe tu tasyāḥ jihvā viśeṣeṇa viśṛtā āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Sovra tutto ’l sabbion, d’un cader lento, 29 piovean di foco dilatate falde, 30 come di neve in alpe sanza vento.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Over all the sand, with a slow descent, 29 dilated flakes of fire were falling, 30 like snow in the Alps without wind.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Sarvasya bālukasya upari, mandena patanena, 29 prapatan diptānalasya vistīrṇāḥ patākāḥ, 30 hemagiriṣu anilam vinā hima iva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Quali Alessandro in quelle parti calde 32 d’Indïa vide sopra ’l süo stuolo 33 fiamme cadere infino a terra salde,
34 per ch’ei provide a scalpitar lo suolo 35 con le sue schiere, acciò che lo vapore 36 mei si stingueva mentre ch’era solo:
37 tale scendeva l’etternale ardore; 38 onde la rena s’accendea, com’ esca 39 sotto focile, a doppiar lo dolore.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Like Alexander in those hot regions 32 of India saw upon his army 33 flames falling steadily to the ground,
34 so that he ordered his troops to trample the ground 35 with their hooves, so that the vapor 36 would be extinguished while it was still alone:
37 thus descended the eternal burning; 38 from which the sand was kindled, like tinder 39 under a flint, to double the pain.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Yathā Alexanderḥ tatsuṣmaparvatadeśeṣu 32 Indīyāyāḥ apaśyat svakīye bale 33 jvālāḥ patantīḥ sthiraṃ bhūtale,
34 yataḥ saḥ ājñāpayām āsa svakīyāṃ senām 35 svairanghaih khurair mṛdam kartum bhūmiṃ, yathā saḥ dhūmaḥ 36 śīghram niśāmyeta yāvad eka eva āsīt:
37 tathāiva avarotat saḥ nityaḥ tapaḥ, 38 yataḥ balukāḥ prajvalitāḥ abhavan, yathā agnidagdham kāṣṭham 39 praharaṇasya adhaḥ, duḥkham dvigunatīkartum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Sanza riposo mai era la tresca 41 de le misere mani, or quindi or quinci 42 escotendo da sé l’arsura fresca.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Without rest were the wretched hands ever, 41 now here, now there, brushing off the fresh burning.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Anivartamānā eva āsīt vyasanāni 41 duḥkhitānāṃ hastānāṃ, iha tatra ca 42 vināśayantīnāṃ svayam eva dagdhvānalam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 I’ cominciai: «Maestro, tu che vinci 44 tutte le cose, fuor che ’ demon duri 45 ch’a l’intrar de la porta incontra uscinci,
46 chi è quel grande che non par che curi 47 lo ’ncendio e giace dispettoso e torto, 48 sì che la pioggia non par che ’l marturi?».
query.result:
**English:**
43 I began: "Master, you who conquer 44 all things, except for those stubborn demons 45 who met us at the entrance to the gate,
46 who is that great one who does not seem to care 47 about the fire and lies there scornful and twisted, 48 so that the rain does not seem to bother him?"
**Sanskrit:**
43 Ahamarabham: "He gurudeva, tvaṃ yaḥ sarvāṇi 44 vijayase, vinā taiḥ kathinair asurair eva 45 ye dvārapraveśe asmān abhimukhībhūya nirakurvan,
46 kaḥ ayam mahān yaḥ na iva manyate 47 agnidāham api, śete ca avajñāpūrṇo viparītaś ca, 48 yathā varṣaḥ api tam na iva pidayati?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 E quel medesmo, che si fu accorto 50 ch’io domandava il mio duca di lui, 51 gridò: «Qual io fui vivo, tal son morto.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And that same one, who had noticed 50 that I was asking my guide about him, 51 cried out: "As I was alive, so I am dead.
**Sanskrit:**
49 Sa eva ca yaḥ pratyabudhyata 50 mama svāminaṃ tasya viṣaye mām pṛcchata iti, 51 akarodita: "Yathā aham jīvita āsīt, tathā aham mṛtaḥ asmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Se Giove stanchi ’l suo fabbro da cui 53 crucciato prese la folgore aguta 54 onde l’ultimo dì percosso fui;
55 o s’elli stanchi li altri a muta a muta 56 in Mongibello a la focina negra, 57 chiamando “Buon Vulcano, aiuta, aiuta!”,
58 sì com’ el fece a la pugna di Flegra, 59 e me saetti con tutta sua forza: 60 non ne potrebbe aver vendetta allegra».

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Allora il duca mio parlò di forza 62 tanto, ch’i’ non l’avea sì forte udito: 63 «O Capaneo, in ciò che non s’ammorza
64 la tua superbia, se’ tu più punito; 65 nullo martiro, fuor che la tua rabbia, 66 sarebbe al tuo furor dolor compito».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then my leader spoke with such force 62 that I had never heard him so strong: 63 "O Capaneus, in that your pride is not quenched, 64 you are punished all the more; 65 no torment, except your own rage, 66 would be sufficient pain for your狂怒."
**Sanskrit:**
61 Tatra mama nāyakaḥ uvāca balāt 62 tathā, yathā aham na śuśrāva tam tathā balavat: 63 "He Kāpaneo, yasmāt tava abhimānaḥ na niśāmyate, 64 tasmāt tvam adhikaṃ daṇḍitaḥ asi; 65 na kaścid api vyathā, tava krodhāt anyā, 66 tava krodhārthaṃ pūrṇā duḥkha-rūpiṇī syāt."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Poi si rivolse a me con miglior labbia, 68 dicendo: «Quei fu l’un d’i sette regi 69 ch’assiser Tebe; ed ebbe e par ch’elli abbia
70 Dio in disdegno, e poco par che ’l pregi; 71 ma, com’ io dissi lui, li suoi dispetti 72 sono al suo petto assai debiti fregi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Then he turned to me with a gentler voice, 68 saying: "That was one of the seven kings 69 who besieged Thebes; and he had, and it seems he still has,
70 God in disdain, and he cares little for Him; 71 but, as I told him, his acts of scorn 72 are to his breast most worthy ornaments.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Tataḥ sa mayi śreṣṭhayā vācā pravṛttaḥ, 68 vadan: "Sa ekaḥ āsīt sapta rājñām 69 ye puraḥ Tebeḥ ākramaṇam cakruḥ; tasya ca āsīt, tathā ca abhāti yathā tasya adhunāpi asti,
70 Devaḥ avajñāyām, sa ca devam alpam eva manyate; 71 yathā ca aham tasmai avocatam, tasya avajñāḥ 72 tasya urasyaiva atiśaya-śobhanāni bhūṣaṇāni santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Or mi vien dietro, e guarda che non metti, 74 ancor, li piedi ne la rena arsiccia; 75 ma sempre al bosco tien li piedi stretti».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Now follow me, and take heed that you do not place 74 your feet again in the burning sand; 75 but keep them always close together in the wood."
**Sanskrit:**
73 Adyaiva mama paścād āgaccha, paśya ca yathā na nikṣipasi, 74 punaḥ, pādayoḥ bālukāyāṃ dagdhāyāṃ; 75 api tu sarvadā vane eva pādayoḥ samīpe rakṣa."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Tacendo divenimmo là ’ve spiccia 77 fuor de la selva un picciol fiumicello, 78 lo cui rossore ancor mi raccapriccia.
query.result:
**English:**
76 In silence we came to where the little stream 77 rushes forth from the forest, 78 the redness of which still horrifies me.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Tūṣṇīm sthitvā āgamyāma tatra yatra 77 vaneḥ bahiḥ kṣudraḥ nadiḥ pravahate, 78 yasya raktavarṇataiva adyāpi mama romañcaṃ janayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Quale del Bulicame esce ruscello 80 che parton poi tra lor le peccatrici, 81 tal per la rena giù sen giva quello.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Like a stream that flows from the Bulicame, 80 which the sinful women then share among themselves, 81 so did that stream flow down over the sand.
**Sanskrit:**
79 Yathā Bulikāmāt pravāhati nadī, 80 Yām paścāt pāpa-strīyaḥ svayam eva vibhajante, 81 Tathā sa nadī vālukāyāṃ pravahati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Lo fondo suo e ambo le pendici 83 fatt’ era ’n pietra, e ’ margini dallato; 84 per ch’io m’accorsi che ’l passo era lici.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Its bottom and both of its slopes 83 were made of stone, and the edges all around; 84 because of which I realized that the passage was narrow.
**Sanskrit:**
82 Tasya adhaḥsthalaṃ ca ubhe ca parśve 83 cakrire aśmāmayaṃ, tathaiva parimāṇḍalam; 84 yataḥ aham ajānāṃ tatra gamanam durgamam iti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 «Tra tutto l’altro ch’i’ t’ho dimostrato, 86 poscia che noi intrammo per la porta 87 lo cui sogliare a nessuno è negato,
88 cosa non fu da li tuoi occhi scorta 89 notabile com’ è ’l presente rio, 90 che sovra sé tutte fiammelle ammorta».
query.result:
**English:**
85 "Among all the other things that I have shown you, 86 after we entered through the gate 87 whose threshold is denied to no one,
88 what thing was not perceived by your eyes 89 as remarkable as the present stream, 90 which quenches all flames above it"?
**Sanskrit:**
85 Sarveṣāmanyānāṃyadyadete darśitam mayā, 86 tataḥ paścāt praveśo yadā mayā kṛtaḥ 87 yasyāḥ śikṣā na kenāpi pratiṣiddhyate,
88 kim na dṛṣṭam tava cakṣuṣā 89 asmād adhikaṃ lakṣaṇīyam, 90 yat sarvāṇi jvalanāni upaśamayati?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Queste parole fuor del duca mio; 92 per ch’io ’l pregai che mi largisse ’l pasto 93 di cui largito m’avëa il disio.
query.result:
**English:**
91 These words came from my leader; 92 therefore I begged him to grant me the food 93 for which he had given me the desire.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Etāni vacāṃsi babhūvuḥ mama netā; 92 Atas tasya prārthayām āsa aham yathā sa me prayacchet āhāram 93 Yasmāt āhārasya icchām mama prayacchata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 «In mezzo mar siede un paese guasto», 95 diss’ elli allora, «che s’appella Creta, 96 sotto ’l cui rege fu già ’l mondo casto.
query.result:
**English:**
94 "In the middle of the sea sits a ruined land," 95 he said then, "which is called Crete, 96 under whose king the world was once pure.
**Sanskrit:**
94 "Madhye samudrasya vartate deśaḥ kṣīṇaḥ", 95 uvāca sa tadā, "yaḥ abhidhīyate Kr̥tā, 96 yasya rājñaḥ adhastāt āsīt pūrvaṃ jagat pavitram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Una montagna v’è che già fu lieta 98 d’acqua e di fronde, che si chiamò Ida; 99 or è diserta come cosa vieta.
query.result:
**English:**
97 There is a mountain that once was joyful 98 with water and leaves, which was called Ida; 99 now it is deserted like something old and worn out.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Parvataḥ asti yaḥ pūrvaṃ āsīt sukhamayaḥ 98 jalair vṛkṣaiś ca, yaḥ ucyate Idaḥ; 99 adhunā nirjanaḥ asti yathā vastunaḥ purātanasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Rëa la scelse già per cuna fida 101 del suo figliuolo, e per celarlo meglio, 102 quando piangea, vi facea far le grida.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Rhea chose it once as a safe cradle 101 for her son, and to better conceal him, 102 when he cried, she made the Curetes raise a clamor.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Rāyā tām pūrvaṃ varayiṣṭhāṃ śiśoḥ 101 Svakiyasya guhāṃ cakāra śobhanām, 102 Yatra rodīti sma saumyaḥ śiśuḥ, tatraiva 103 Kuhakair ghoṣaḥ kṛtaḥ āsīt sadā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Dentro dal monte sta dritto un gran veglio, 104 che tien volte le spalle inver’ Dammiata 105 e Roma guarda come süo speglio.
query.result:
**English:**
103 Within the mountain stands a great old man, 104 who turns his back ten times toward Damietta 105 and looks at Rome as if it were his mirror.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Parvatasya madhye tiṣṭhati mahān vṛddhaḥ, 104 yaḥ daśa kṛtvā pṛṣṭham prati Damiyatām 105 Rūmān paśyati yathā svakīyam darpaṇam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Ciascuna parte, fuor che l’oro, è rotta 113 d’una fessura che lagrime goccia, 114 le quali, accolte, fóran quella grotta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Every part, except the gold, is broken 113 by a fissure that drips tears, 114 which, collected, would bore through that cave.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Sarva eva bhāgaḥ, hema-vinā, bhinnaḥ 113 Bhidena yaḥ aśru-bindu-pravāhin, 114 Ye samāhṛtāḥ, teshām sa guhā bhidyeta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Lor corso in questa valle si diroccia; 116 fanno Acheronte, Stige e Flegetonta; 117 poi sen van giù per questa stretta doccia,
118 infin, là ove più non si dismonta, 119 fanno Cocito; e qual sia quello stagno 120 tu lo vedrai, però qui non si conta».
query.result:
**English:**
115 Their course in this valley is from a rock; 116 they form Acheron, Styx, and Phlegethon; 117 then they go down through this narrow channel,
118 finally, where one can descend no further, 119 they form Cocytus; and what that marsh is like 120 you will see, but it is not told here.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Teṣāṃ gatiḥ asmin khaṇḍe prastara-utpattirūpā; 116 Aceraṇaṃ, Styx, Phlegeton iti nāmadheyāni kurvanti; 117 tataḥ imām saṅkīrṇām dhārām anugamya,
118 ante, yatra adhikaṃ na ava-tiṣṭhati, 119 Kokaītaṃ kurvanti; tat tatra sthitaṃ jalaṃ katham-rūpaṃ syāt, 120 tat tvam drakṣyasi, atra tu na kathitaṃ bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 E io a lui: «Se ’l presente rigagno 122 si diriva così dal nostro mondo, 123 perché ci appar pur a questo vivagno?».
query.result:
**English:**
121 And I to him: "If this present stream 122 flows down thus from our world, 123 why does it appear to us only at this boundary?"
**Sanskrit:**
121 Aham ca tasmai: "Yadi ayam pravahaḥ 122 evam asmāt lokāt pravartate, 123 kimartham ayam asmābhiḥ etasmin eva sīmāntare dṛśyate?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ed elli a me: «Tu sai che ’l loco è tondo; 125 e tutto che tu sie venuto molto, 126 pur a sinistra, giù calando al fondo,
127 non se’ ancor per tutto ’l cerchio vòlto; 128 per che, se cosa n’apparisce nova, 129 non de’ addur maraviglia al tuo volto».
query.result:
**English:**
124 And he to me: "You know that the place is round; 125 and although you have come a long way, 126 always to the left, descending down to the bottom,
127 you have not yet gone full circle; 128 therefore, if something new appears to you, 129 it should not cause wonder on your face."
**Sanskrit:**
124 Sa ca mama: "Tvam jānāsi yad idam sthānam vṛttam asti; 125 Api ca yadyapi tvam dirgham mārgaṃ gataḥ asi, 126 Tathāpi vāmasyām diśi, adhastāt avahanamāṇaḥ,
127 Na tvam sarvam cakram paribhramaṇaṃ kṛtavān asi; 128 Tasmāt, yadi kaścid arthaḥ navīnaḥ asmābhiḥ dṛśyate, 129 Na tava mukhe āścaryam janayitum arhati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 E io ancor: «Maestro, ove si trova 131 Flegetonta e Letè? ché de l’un taci, 132 e l’altro di’ che si fa d’esta piova».
query.result:
**English:**
130 And I again: "Master, where is 131 Phlegethon and Lethe? For you are silent about one, 132 and you say that the other is made from this rain."
**Sanskrit:**
130 Aham ca punar abravam: "He gurudeva, kutra asti 131 Phlegethōn nadi Letē ca? Yataḥ ekena tvaṃ maunam āśritaḥ asi, 132 anyena ca bruṣe yad ayam varṣaḥ tena eva nirmitaḥ asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 «In tutte tue question certo mi piaci», 134 rispuose, «ma ’l bollor de l’acqua rossa 135 dovea ben solver l’una che tu faci.
query.result:
**English:**
133 "In all your questions you certainly please me," 134 he replied, "but the boiling of the red water 135 should have solved the one that you are asking.
**Sanskrit:**
133 "Sarveṣu teṣu praśneṣu niścitam mama priyaḥ asi," 134 iti sa pratyāha, "api tu rakta-jalarāgasaḥ 135 tava kṛtaḥ ekaḥ praśnaḥ tena eva siddhāntaḥ kartavyam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Letè vedrai, ma fuor di questa fossa, 137 là dove vanno l’anime a lavarsi 138 quando la colpa pentuta è rimossa».
query.result:
**English:**
136 You will see Lethe, but outside this ditch, 137 where the souls go to wash themselves 138 when the repented fault is removed.
**Sanskrit:**
136 Letām drakṣyasi, api tu bahiḥ asya khātāt, 137 tatra yatra ātmānaḥ gacchanti snātum 138 yadā prāyaścitta-pūrṇo 'parādhaḥ apahṛtaḥ bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Poi disse: «Omai è tempo da scostarsi 140 dal bosco; fa che di retro a me vegne: 141 li margini fan via, che non son arsi,
142 e sopra loro ogne vapor si spegne».
query.result:
**English:**
139 Then he said: "Now is the time to depart 140 from the woods; see that you follow me: 141 the edges form a path, which are not burned,
142 and every vapor is extinguished above them."
**Sanskrit:**
139 Tataḥ sa uvāca: "Adyaiva kālaḥ pravṛttaḥ 140 aranyaṃ parityaktum; paśya mama paścād āgaccha: 141 paryāyāḥ panthānaṃ kurvanti, ye na dagdhāḥ santi,
142 teṣāṃ ca upari sarvaḥ vāṣpaḥ nirvāyate."
